title: Chained consumer price index of all urban consumers 2000 to 2019
summary: This is a bar chart representing December value in the x axis and Chained Consumer Price Index (1999=100) in the y axis.
December value 2019 has the highest Chained Consumer Price Index (1999=100) and 2000 has the lowest Chained Consumer Price Index (1999=100).
There is a difference of 42.13 between the maximum December value 2019 and minimum December value 2000.
min_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Chained Consumer Price Index (1999=100) for 20 number of December values.
The Chained Consumer Price Index (1999=100) is highest at December value 2019 and lowest at December value 2000.
mid_summary: This is a bar chart representing December value in the x axis and Chained Consumer Price Index (1999=100) in the y axis.
December value 2019 has the highest Chained Consumer Price Index (1999=100) and 2000 has the lowest Chained Consumer Price Index (1999=100).
There is a difference of 42.13 between the maximum December value 2019 and minimum December value 2000.
max_summary: This bar chart has 20 columns on the x axis representing December value, and Chained Consumer Price Index (1999=100) in each December value on the y axis.
December value 2019 has the highest Chained Consumer Price Index (1999=100) and 2000 has the lowest Chained Consumer Price Index (1999=100).
December value 2018 has the second highest value for Chained Consumer Price Index (1999=100).
The highest December value 2019 has 42.13 more Chained Consumer Price Index (1999=100) than the lowest December value 2000.
December value 2019 is higher than any other December values with value 144.73, followed by 2018, and 2017. Down to December value 2000 with the lowest value 102.6.
The lowest value 102.6 at 2000 is almost 1.17 times smaller than the average value 124.19.
